pullRequest.title: Pipeline script for Build_JDK_Timeout_Handler job
pullRequest.bodyText:
Creates openj9jtregtimeouthandler.jar, which is used to replace the
default timeout handler when running OpenJDK tests on OpenJ9. It uses an
OpenJ9 command to create a core file in addition to running jstack.
Issue #9651
[ci skip]
The jenkins job is https://ci.eclipse.org/openj9/view/Infrastructure/job/Build_JDK_Timeout_Handler. The script is a copy of the script currently in the job, which ran successfully. The jenkins job only needs to be re-run when https://github.com/ibmruntimes/openj9-openjdk-jdk/blob/openj9/closed/test/jtreg-ext/jtreg/openj9/CoreDumpTimeoutHandler.java is modified.
The generated files are used by adoptium/TKG#85

beforeCommit.message:
Pipeline script for Build_JDK_Timeout_Handler job

Creates openj9jtregtimeouthandler.jar, which is used to replace the
default timeout handler when running OpenJDK tests on OpenJ9. It uses an
OpenJ9 command to create a core file in addition to running jstack.

Issue https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/issues/9651

[ci skip]

Signed-off-by: Peter Shipton <Peter_Shipton@ca.ibm.com>

nodes.bodyText: Keep in mind this includes the time waiting for a machine. Since it's a worker there should be available executors unless you launch it at an inopportune time.
